Episodes.Title: Chapter 1
Episodes.Plot: When the newly elected President reneges on a promise, Francis and Claire decide to sever all allegiances and toss the rules out the window.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Offensive language,sexual references and drug use
Episodes.GuestStars: Jayne Atkinson, Dan Ziskie, Elizabeth Norment, Rachel Brosnahan

Episodes.Title: Chapter 2
Episodes.Plot: Francis and Doug plan to frame Secretary of State nominee, Michael Kern. Meanwhile, Zoe's popularity at the Washington Herald continues to grow.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Offensive language,sexual references and drug use

Episodes.Title: Chapter 3
Episodes.Plot: Francis heads for his hometown to deal with a crisis. Zoe negotiates the politics of being a journalist on the rise. Claire finds herself a new business partner.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Offensive language,sexual references and drug use

Episodes.Title: Chapter 4
Episodes.Plot: Francis shakes down the Congressional leadership. Zoe is offered the promotion of White House Correspondent and doesn't know if she should take it or not.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Offensive language,sexual references and drug use

Episodes.Title: Chapter 5
Episodes.Plot: A feud starts between Francis and Marty Spinella. Russo goes into depression about the job losses at the shipyards.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Offensive language,sexual references and drug use

Episodes.Title: Chapter 6
Episodes.Plot: The strike between Frank and Marty starts to get out of hand. Russo has decided to run for Governor of Pennsylvania.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Offensive language,sexual references and drug use

Episodes.Title: Chapter 7
Episodes.Plot: Frank helps Peter get ready for his governor race, but Peter is starting to have second thoughts. Doug tries to help a young hooker in trouble.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Offensive language and sexual references

Episodes.Title: Chapter 8
Episodes.Plot: Frank has a library named after him at his old military school. Peter tries to win back the support of his hometown.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Offensive language and sexual references

Episodes.Title: Chapter 9
Episodes.Plot: Frank tries to do whatever it takes to get the new bill passed in Congress. Russo goes on a bus campaign with the Vice President, but the VP is not making it an easy trip for him. Zoe's relationship with Frank gets a little bumpy.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Offensive language and sexual references

Episodes.Title: Chapter 10
Episodes.Plot: Claire fuels an old flame. Peter wrestles with his demons. Francis crosses the point of no return.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Offensive language and sexual references

Episodes.Title: Chapter 11
Episodes.Plot: Zoe extends her time away from The Hill while Francis tracks down Russo and engages in damage control.
Episodes.Writer: Keith Huff, Kate Barnow, Beau Willimon

Episodes.Title: Chapter 12
Episodes.Plot: The President sends Frank to St. Louis to persuade Raymond Tusk into becoming the new Vice President. Zoe and Janine investigate Peter Russo's death.

Episodes.Title: Chapter 13
Episodes.Plot: Frank scrambles to keep his plan on track. Gillian is planning to sue Claire. Zoe, Janine, and Lucas investigate Rachel Posner and her relationship with Peter Russo.
